author: Staff Reporter
text:
The National Deworming Day was observed in Puducherry and Cuddalore on Wednesday.

The Health Department distributed deworming tablets to students of government and private schools to protect children from intestinal worms. The tablets were distributed at 474 government schools and 236 private schools and 788 Anganwadi centres.

In Puducherry, there are 4,27,418 children in the in the 1-19 age group group. Parasitic worms could lead to malnutrition and cause abdominal pain. Unhygienic practices and use of public toilets might lead to worm infection.

In India, nearly 241 million children below the age of 15 are affected by worms. At least 56 per cent of children below the age of five suffer from growth retardation.

The tablets were distributed at pre-schools, primary and higher secondary schools in Cuddalore. Those who were unable to get the tablets could get them from the distribution camps set up at the schools till February 15.
title: Deworming tablets distributed
